title: Academic Preprint Feedback Manager
description: Consolidate and prioritize peer feedback on your preprint manuscripts by pasting preprint URLs and raw feedback comments to generate actionable summaries and response plans.
inputLabel: Enter your preprint URLs and paste raw feedback comments (optionally upload feedback files).
outputLabel: Consolidated feedback summary and prioritized action item list
systemPrompt: You are an assistant helping academic researchers consolidate and organize peer feedback on their preprint manuscripts. Accept input containing preprint URLs and raw feedback comments or notes. Parse and normalize the input, identify key topics and sentiment, prioritize feedback items, and produce a clear, structured summary report with action items prioritized by urgency and relevance. Clearly separate public feedback from private notes. Refuse requests that include manuscript full text or any confidential data without explicit consent. Output only plain text summaries and action lists unless structured output is enabled. Enforce privacy and safety rigorously. If input is invalid or disallowed, respond with a clear refusal message.

presets.label: Summary Focus
presets.prompt: Please consolidate the pasted feedback into a clear summary report highlighting main topics and sentiment.

presets.label: Action Items Focus
presets.prompt: Generate a prioritized list of actionable response items and revision tasks from the feedback.

presets.label: Full Consolidation
presets.prompt: Provide a combined feedback summary with topic clusters, sentiment analysis, and action item prioritization.

jsonSchemaHint: If structured-output enabled, output JSON with keys: summary (string), actionItems (array of {task:string, priority:number, deadline:string|null}), feedbackSources (array of strings).
clarifyPrompt: Please provide the preprint URLs and raw feedback comments or upload feedback files. Specify if any notes are private. Avoid sharing manuscript full text.
finalizePrompt: Review the consolidated feedback summary and prioritized action items. Confirm if you want to export or save this data.

idea.workingTitle: Academic Research Preprint Peer Engagement Manager

niche.scenario: Managing and organizing community feedback and interactions on their uploaded preprint manuscripts across multiple platforms before formal journal submission

idea.problem: Academic researchers often upload preprints to multiple platforms (e.g., arXiv, bioRxiv, institutional repositories) and receive scattered, unstructured feedback and discussion comments from peers, making it difficult to track, prioritize, and respond efficiently during the critical pre-submission phase.
inputs: Links or identifiers to preprint uploads on various servers
Raw feedback comments, peer review notes, and discussion threads (imported or pasted)
Researcherâ€™s own notes or response drafts
Metadata about preprint versions and submission timelines
outputs: Consolidated, prioritized feedback summary report organized by topic and sentiment
Structured action item list for responses and manuscript revisions with deadlines
Engagement dashboard showing feedback sources, activity timelines, and response status
Exportable summaries and response drafts for collaborator sharing
whyItWins: Addresses a currently underserved, critical pre-publication phase distinct from formal peer review
Consolidates fragmented feedback from multiple platforms into a single actionable interface
Supports ongoing, iterative manuscript improvement with clear prioritization of community inputs
Boosts researcher productivity and response quality during a repetitive, high-impact workflow

upgradePath.today: A lightweight web tool where researchers paste or upload preprint URLs and feedback comments to generate a consolidated feedback summary and action list
upgradePath.in90Days: Add integrations with popular preprint servers APIs to auto-import comments and discussion threads, plus user accounts to save multiple projects
upgradePath.in12Months: Develop a full multi-page app with real-time notifications, collaborative team commenting, versioned response tracking, analytics on engagement trends, and export to manuscript management software

riskNotes: Must ensure privacy and compliance by not storing or exposing confidential manuscript content without explicit consent
Avoid offering any formal peer review or editorial judgments to remain advisory/supportive only
Careful handling of diverse platform APIs and comment formats to maintain data integrity
Must clearly distinguish between public feedback and private notes to prevent accidental sharing

blueprint.primaryUser: Academic researchers managing preprint feedback and engagement

edgeCases: Handling inconsistent or malformed feedback data from diverse platform APIs.
Managing API rate limits and failures during feedback import without data loss.
Ensuring private notes are never exposed in shared exports or public views.
Supporting projects with multiple preprint versions and overlapping feedback timelines.
Gracefully handling user session expiration during active feedback management.
Detecting and merging duplicate or highly similar feedback comments.
Providing fallback for manual feedback input when API integrations fail or are unavailable.
nonGoals: Providing formal peer review or editorial judgments on manuscript quality.
Hosting or storing full manuscript content beyond metadata and user notes.
Replacing existing manuscript submission or journal peer review systems.
Supporting real-time chat or discussion forums beyond imported feedback consolidation.
Automated manuscript rewriting or content generation based on feedback.

dataFlow: User accesses /login page and submits email and password to /api/auth/login; receives authentication token on success.
Authenticated user requests /projects page; frontend calls GET /api/projects to fetch list of user's preprint projects.
User navigates to /projects/new to create a new project; submits form data to POST /api/projects; server validates and stores project metadata in data-preprintProject.
User views /projects/:id; frontend calls GET /api/projects/:id to retrieve detailed project info including consolidated feedback and action items from data-preprintProject and data-feedback.
User submits new feedback via POST /api/projects/:id/feedback; API normalizes, performs sentiment analysis, tags, and stores feedback in data-feedback.

Background job periodically triggers feedback aggregation job-feedbackAggregation, which calls integration-preprintAPIs to fetch new feedback from external preprint servers, normalizes and updates data-feedback.
User requests export at /projects/:id/export; frontend calls GET /api/projects/:id/export with format; API generates export file from consolidated data and returns export URL.
Throughout, api-user manages authentication and authorization, ensuring user-specific data isolation and access control.
validationRules: Login API: email must be valid email format; password must be non-empty string.
Project creation: title is required, non-empty string; preprintUrls must be non-empty array of valid URLs; versionMetadata and submissionTimeline if provided must be valid JSON objects.
Project detail retrieval: project ID must exist and belong to authenticated user.
Feedback submission: content is required, non-empty string; sourcePlatform is required and must be among supported platforms; isPrivateNote defaults to false if omitted.
Export request: format must be among supported export formats (e.g., PDF, DOCX, JSON).
All APIs requiring authentication must validate session token and user identity.
Data fields like dates must be valid ISO 8601 strings where applicable.
errorHandling: Return 400 Bad Request with descriptive error messages on validation failures.
Return 401 Unauthorized when authentication token is missing, invalid, or expired.
Return 403 Forbidden if user attempts to access or modify projects or feedback not owned by them.
Return 404 Not Found if requested project or feedback does not exist.
Handle external API failures in integration-preprintAPIs with retries, exponential backoff, and log errors; surface user-friendly messages if manual feedback input is needed.
For background job failures, log errors and retry according to schedule; do not block user operations.
On unexpected server errors, return 500 Internal Server Error with generic message and log details internally.
securityNotes: Use HTTPS for all client-server communications to protect tokens and sensitive data.
Store hashed passwords using strong hashing algorithms (e.g., bcrypt) with salts.
Implement secure session management with HTTP-only, secure cookies or token-based authentication (e.g., JWT).
Enforce strict access control on all API routes to ensure users can only access their own data.
Encrypt sensitive user data at rest, especially authentication credentials and private notes.
Sanitize all user inputs to prevent injection attacks.
Ensure private notes and feedback marked as private are never exposed in public APIs or exports.
Rate limit API endpoints to prevent abuse and brute force attacks.
Validate and sanitize data imported from external preprint APIs to prevent malformed or malicious content.
